item.title: MySQL Daemon Startup Fix ğŸ› ï¸ğŸ•µï¸
item.author: iam2kabhishek@gmail.com (2KAbhishek)
item.description:
Problem

Brief: MySQL daemon fails to start

Details: So, I recently installed MariaDB (Community fork of MySQL) on my Manjaro system and when I started the system with:

sudo systemctl start mysqld

This is the error I get:

Job for mariadb.service failed because the control process exited with error code.

Let’s look at journalctl -xe:

A start job for unit mariadb.service has finished with a failure.

Not very helpful, let’s look at mysqld’s status with: systemctl status mysqld

item.title: Trim Unnecessary Files From Git History âœ‚ï¸ğŸ—ƒï¸
item.author: iam2kabhishek@gmail.com (2KAbhishek)
item.description:
Here’s a common scenario, You have committed a file to your git repo and have also pushed to remote.

The file wasn’t supposed to be there, maybe it was something you forgot to mention in your gitignore or something that was supposed to be an environment variable, or maybe it was a binary not related to the project at all ( Cat GIFs? ğŸ˜‰).

This not only raises some security concerns but also drives the size of your repository up and simply deleting the file won’t fix the problem.
